common.subtitle: Taiwan AI Policy Vote
common.disclaimer: This platform is currently in beta version, and the collection of questions and opinions is for reference only and not related to actual legislation.

questions.title: TAIVote: Taiwan AI Policy Vote
questions.description: Welcome to 'TAIVote: Taiwan AI Policy Vote.' Please answer the following questions based on your thoughts. Your opinions will help shape a more representative AI Basic Law. Together, we can work towards a better Taiwan. Thank you for your participation!
questions.submitDescription: You have completed the voting process! Please click the button below to submit your choices. Note: You can only submit your vote once. If you need to modify your answers, use the back button in the top left corner to make changes. Thank you for participating!
questions.doneDescription: Your vote has been completed. You can click the button below to view the immediate vote results.

section1.title: 1. Personal Views on AI
section1.question1: At this stage, do you believe it is more important for the Taiwanese government to 'Encourage AI Innovation' or 'Regulate AI'?
section1.question2: Who do you think should hold the copyright for AI-generated content?
options2: The developer/company of the AI system
The individual/organization using the AI system
The original authors of the data used to train the AI
section1.question3: How do you believe 'AI Medical Diagnostic Systems' should be regulated?
options3: They should only be used as auxiliary tools, with final decisions made by human doctors
They can make independent diagnoses but must be supervised by human doctors
section1.question4: How should AI applications in the job market be regulated?
options4: AI should be restricted from replacing human jobs
No intervention, allow the market to develop freely

section2.title: 2. Views on AI Development in Taiwan
section2.question1: Do you support Taiwan enacting an 'AI Basic Law' to regulate the development and application of AI?
section2.question2: Do you support the Ministry of Education allocating a budget for 'AI Equity' to cover AI-related training courses and software fees for teachers and students at all levels?
section2.question3: Do you support the Taiwanese government making public sector and publicly funded content available for AI training without liability or cost?
section2.question4: Do you support the Taiwanese government expanding or amending copyright laws, similar to Japan, to allow AI to use all local Taiwanese text corpora, images, and videos for training without authorization and free of charge?
section2.question5: Do you believe decisions made by AI systems should be transparent and explainable to humans?
section2.question6: 'Sovereign AI' aims to reduce reliance on external technologies and supply chains, ensuring full control and autonomy over AI development, data access, and decision-making processes. Do you support the Taiwanese government making the development mechanisms, budget, and processes for 'Sovereign AI' transparent and involving public participation?
section2.question7: Do you support the Taiwanese government collaborating with international third parties for 'AI Ethics and Safety Assessments'?
section2.question8: Do you support Taiwan participating in the establishment of an 'International AI Transparency Organization' to help all countries address AI development and safety issues? (Reference video: https://youtu.be/GFFr42xaNtg)

section3.title: 3. Views on the Direction and Content of Taiwan's 'AI Basic Law'
section3.question1: Do you believe this law should promote AI industry innovation while ensuring that employment opportunities are not significantly displaced?
section3.question2: Do you agree that this law should regulate and review high-risk AI applications?
section3.question3: Do you agree that this law should enhance protection for personal privacy and data security in AI systems?
section3.question4: Do you believe this law should require AI technologies to adhere to ethical standards to prevent bias and discrimination?
section3.question5: Do you support this law establishing transparent mechanisms to allow the public to understand how AI systems make decisions?
section3.question6: Do you support this law requiring the Taiwanese government to invest in AI education and training to improve public AI literacy?
section3.question7: Do you agree that this law should encourage the application of AI technologies in public services such as healthcare and education?
section3.question8: Do you support this law requiring the Taiwanese government to participate in international cooperation to jointly establish standards and regulations for AI development?
section3.question9: Do you agree that this law should prioritize environmental sustainability and social responsibility in AI development?
